      • relocateFutureLegRoute

        @Deprecated
public boolean relocateFutureLegRoute(Leg leg,
                                                  Id<Link> fromLinkId,
                                                  Id<Link> toLinkId,
                                                  Person person)
        Deprecated. 
        Re-locates a future route. The route is given by its leg. It just replaces the route for the given leg, without looking after overall plan consistency.
        Returns:
        true when replacing the route worked, false when something went wrong

      • relocateFutureLegRoute

        @Deprecated
public static boolean relocateFutureLegRoute(Leg leg,
                                                         Id<Link> fromLinkId,

                                                         Person person,
                                                         Network network,
                                                         TripRouter tripRouter)
        Deprecated. switch this to relocateFutureTrip, since with egress legs relocating the destination of a single leg leads to disconnected trips. kai, dec'15
        Re-locates a future route. The route is given by its leg.
        Returns:
        true when replacing the route worked, false when something went wrong

      • replanFutureLegRoute

        public boolean replanFutureLegRoute(Leg leg,
                                    Person person)
        Re-plans a future route. The route is given by its leg. It is expected that the leg's route is not null and that the start- and end link Ids are set properly. If the start- and or end-location of the leg have changed, use relocateFutureLegRoute(...)!
        Returns:
        true when replacing the route worked, false when something went wrong

      • relocateCurrentLegRoute

        @Deprecated
public boolean relocateCurrentLegRoute(Leg leg,
                                                   Person person,
                                                   int currentLinkIndex,
                                                   Id<Link> toLinkId,
                                                   double time)
        Deprecated. 
        Re-locates a current route. The route is given by its leg. Does not look after plans consistency!
        Returns:
        true when replacing the route worked, false when something went wrong

      • replanCurrentLegRoute

        public boolean replanCurrentLegRoute(Leg leg,
                                     Person person,
                                     int currentLinkIndex,
                                     double time)
        We create a new Plan which contains only the Leg that should be replanned and its previous and next Activities. By doing so the PlanAlgorithm will only change the Route of that Leg. Use currentNodeIndex from a DriverAgent if possible! Otherwise code it as following: startLink - Node1 - routeLink1 - Node2 - routeLink2 - Node3 - endLink The currentNodeIndex has to Point to the next Node (which is the endNode of the current Link)

      • getPathCalculator

        public final LeastCostPathCalculator getPathCalculator()
